title: Ecological Constraint-Based Jump Performance Analysis and Training Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational theories of sports science, understanding of biomechanics and physiological mechanisms
context.additional_context: Course emphasizing constraint analysis reflecting real-game environments and cultivating training design capabilities

learning_goals: Constraints in competitive environments—individual (goal setting), environmental (wind conditions), and task-related (takeoff board rules)—can be systematically analyzed.
Training tasks based on an ecological approach can be designed to assess motor performance in contexts similar to actual competitions.
The complexity of jumping movements can be understood from a systemic interaction perspective, and functional movement solutions can be explored.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
